page.title: 18SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: Cratfield Town Estate Charity is administered by three ex officio Trustees (vicar & 2 churchwardens) and 6 other representatives of local organisations. The monies are divided equally between the Church, the Public Purposes & the Poor. The doctor's surgery is held twice weekly in the Village hall, the main surgery being at Fressingfield. Nom-urgent prescriptions are left & collected at the shop.The shop, combining a well stocked store, a post office and a public house which is a free house fulfills a social requirement.Two households use the home help service. Some Cratfield villagers deliver Meals on Wheels to those in need locally, though none is needed in Cratfield at present.The Parish Council owns a wheel chair available to all. There are 2 public'phones & a library van.
